subject: Business
title: Hyperbolic Discounting: Now vs. Later
description: A short lesson to help you apply Hyperbolic Discounting: Now vs. Later.

hook.text: Would you rather have $100 today or $110 tomorrow? Most take the $100. But $100 in 30 days or $110 in 31? They wait.

buildup.text: Hyperbolic discounting means we massively overvalue immediate rewards compared to future ones.

discovery.text: This is why people skip retirement saving. The pleasure of spending now dwarfs the abstract future gain.

twist.text: The bias disappears with distance. We plan to start dieting on Monday but never on today.

climax.text: Commitment devices work: auto-transfer to savings, gym contracts, public pledges.

punchline.text: We're patient about the future. Just not about right now.

quiz.question: What is hyperbolic discounting?
options: Overvaluing immediate rewards relative to future ones
Discounting products based on demand curves
A pricing strategy for digital goods
